title.narrative: Mechanism 14254 - Stigma and discrimination

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
The recently awarded three-year RESPECT project will reduce HIV-related S&D of KPs, including PWID, MSM, FSWs, and PLWHA by HCPs in Ukraine. The specific objectives are to: 1) institutionalize KP and PLWHA-friendly policies in 12 pilot health facilities in Kyiv and Donetsk Oblasts, (2) introduce S&D training modules for HCPs at 4 pre-and in-service medical education institutions, and (3) increase Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.4: Biomedical Prevention - Injection Safety. Policies, training, waste-management systems, advocacy and other activities to promote medical injection safety, including distribution/supply chain, cost and appropriate disposal of injection equipment and other related equipment and supplies. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.16: Biomedical Prevention - Prevention Among Injecting and Non-Injecting Drug Users. Activities including policy reform, training, message development, community mobilization and comprehensive approaches including medication assistance therapy to reduce injecting drug use. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. objectives

The recently awarded three-year RESPECT project will reduce HIV-related S&D of KPs, including PWID, MSM, FSWs, and PLWHA by HCPs in Ukraine. The specific objectives are to: 1) institutionalize KP and PLWHA-friendly policies in 12 pilot health facilities in Kyiv and Donetsk Oblasts, (2) introduce S&D training modules for HCPs at 4 pre-and in-service medical education institutions, and (3) increase the internal capacity of the NETWORK to reduce S&D. Achievement of the third objective will sustain project activities through NETWORK’s design and use of a referral system for S&D cases; development of this system will be accompanied by a nationwide scale-up plan for S&D with GoU and other key counterparts. RESPECT contributes to Goals 2 and 3 of Ukraine’s Partnership Framework: to improve the quality and cost-effectiveness of HIV prevention, care, and treatment services for KPs; and to strengthen national and local leadership, capacity, institutions, systems, policies, and resources. The USG recently approved RESPECT’s Project Monitoring & Evaluation Plan. One of the outcome indicators measures the change in the number of KPs who report S&D cases through the referral system. The USG will conduct an external final performance evaluation of project performance. RESPECT works closely with GFATM HIV/AIDS Round 10 Principal Recipients and other USG-funded projects to ensure that relevant project activities are linked and directly contribute to the NAP 2014-2018 goal of “developing tolerance towards PLHIVs and HIV KPs.” As RESPECT is a new project, the USG has invested in start-up activities and will continue to examine ways to bolster its cost-efficiency during the next 3 years.

organisation.narrative: Office of the Global AIDS Coordinator

mailing-address.narrative: 1800 G Street, N.W., Suite 10300, Washington, DC 20006

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.

title.narrative: This area of the State Department website contains the standard terms and conditions documents incorporated by reference into all standard grants, cooperative agreements, fixed amount awards, award to individuals, and property awards to U.S. and foreign recipients that are not Foreign Public Entities.
